Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town Disillusionment and Airport Revelation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan's romanticized view of 'Ghost Town', her rejection of Cal, and the shattering revelation of the town's impending demolition for an airport.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Rejection in Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her dissatisfaction with 'Ghost Town' and rejects Cal's advances, longing for a more romantic and exciting life, unaware of the town's true fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Frustrated Departure
sub_scenes.description: Cal reacts to Nan's rejection with sarcasm and disappointment, his romantic vision of 'Ghost Town' crumbling.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Airport Plans
sub_scenes.description: New characters arrive at Merrick Gulch, confirming it's a 'ghost town' and revealing plans to build an airport, changing its fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Devastation at Ghost Town's Fate
sub_scenes.description: Nan overhears the airport plans and is emotionally devastated by the realization that 'Ghost Town' will be destroyed, contrasting sharply with her romantic ideals.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation, Practicality, and Rejection in a Changing Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Nan apologizing to Cal and attempting a practical view of the airport's development, while also facing unwanted advances, highlighting her changing perspectives and vulnerability.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Apology and Pragmatic Airport View
sub_scenes.description: Nan apologizes to Cal and tries to adopt a practical outlook on the airport, focusing on its benefits, a shift from her earlier romanticism.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Rough Men
sub_scenes.description: Nan faces unwanted advances from rough men, highlighting the changing and potentially dangerous atmosphere of 'Ghost Town' with the impending development.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance

sub_scenes.title: Airport Practicalities and Father's Dismissal
sub_scenes.description: The rough men discuss the practical advantages of the airport, while Nan's father dismisses her concerns, emphasizing business over her feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness

sub_scenes.title: Family Argument and Nan's Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: A heated argument erupts between Nan and her father about horses, leading to Nan's emotional breakdown and feeling of humiliation.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument
Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed

Major_Arcs.title: Seeking Love and Resolving Uncertainty
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's quest for love and clarity in her relationship with Cal, guided by advice from her family and her own resolve.

sub_scenes.title: Family Advice on Love
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives advice from her mother, father, and maid, all encouraging her to pursue love with Cal and understand her own feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Resolve and Pursuit of Cal
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to take action, resolving to understand her feelings for Cal and pursuing him to clarify their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Duties, Father-Daughter Conflict, and Belated Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc intertwines ranch duties with ongoing family tensions and culminates in a belated romantic reunion between Nan and Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Hand's Urgent Request
sub_scenes.description: A ranch hand interrupts Nan's pursuit of Cal with urgent news about arriving horses, highlighting the demands of ranch life.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help

sub_scenes.title: Argument with Father on Horseback
sub_scenes.description: While riding, Nan and her father engage in a conflict over a 'deal', showcasing continued tension in their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Argument with Father About a Deal

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Departure for Work
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal have an emotional conversation where Nan confesses her feelings, and Cal explains his actions before departing for work.

sub_scenes.title: Horses Stampede and Time Skip to Loneliness
sub_scenes.description: A horse stampede occurs, followed by a time skip depicting Nan's growing loneliness during Cal's extended absence.

sub_scenes.title: Belated Confession and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Cal returns and confesses his feelings to Nan, leading to a belated romantic reunion and resolution of their emotional distance.

Major_Arcs.title: The Snowstorm Crisis and Hay Lift Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the onset of a severe snowstorm, the escalating crisis for the ranchers, and the eventual relief brought by the 'Operation Hay Lift'.

sub_scenes.title: Lingering Feelings and Snow Depth Report
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal's reconciled feelings are juxtaposed with initial weather concerns and a report of extreme snow depth, foreshadowing a crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Concerns and Fodder Worries
sub_scenes.description: Characters express growing concern about the severe weather and dwindling fodder supplies, highlighting the practical impact of the snowstorm.

sub_scenes.title: Narrative Interlude and Decision to Act
sub_scenes.description: A narrative interlude emphasizes the relentless snowfall, followed by Cal's decision to take action and address the crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Hope from Above
sub_scenes.description: Cal experiences despair and hopelessness, but the unexpected arrival of a plane dropping fodder brings a sudden shift to hope and relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Resolution and Future Outlook
sub_scenes.description: The arrival of the hay lift leads to emotional resolution between Nan and Cal, and a hopeful outlook on their relationship and future, framed by 'Operation Hay Lift'.

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Skepticism
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting and character, Chane Benson, and the town's skeptical reactions to his actions and reputation, setting up a conflict around heroism and perception.

sub_scenes.title: The Cowboy's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced in a dramatic confrontation, with bystanders reacting with shock and surprise.

sub_scenes.title: Skeptical Reactions to Benson
sub_scenes.description: Onlookers express skepticism and sarcasm about Chane Benson's actions and heroic image.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Jeff's dangerous fascination with guns, his sister's concern, and their escalating confrontation over their father's gun, interwoven with the looming figure of Chane Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Woman's Reminiscence and Concern for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: A woman reflects on her brother Jeff's childhood hero worship of their father and expresses concern about his current unhealthy obsession with guns.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation over Father's Gun
sub_scenes.description: The woman confronts Jeff about him cleaning their father's gun, leading to a heated argument and Jeff's defiant mention of Chane Benson.

Major_Arcs.title: Intervention, Ominous Advice, and Public Accusation of Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Sally and Clyde's intervention with Jeff, the introduction of Mr. Benson with his ominous advice, and the public accusation of Chane Benson in an article, escalating the conflict surrounding Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Concern and Reassurance for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses fear for Jeff and pleads with him to stop his gun obsession, while Clyde reassures her they will guide him away from Benson's influence.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Mr. Benson and Ominous Advice
sub_scenes.description: Sally introduces Mr. Benson, who provides ominous advice and speaks darkly about Chane Benson and violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Public Discussion and Article Accusation
sub_scenes.description: Townspeople discuss Chane Benson's reputation and an article in the 'Juniper Clarion' that accuses him of being a 'murdering killer'.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation, Threats, and Clyde's Defiance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Chane Benson's direct confrontation with Clyde over the article, Sally's warnings, and Clyde's unwavering resolve to publish the truth despite the danger.

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Sally's Warning
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson confronts Clyde in his office, threatening him over the article, while Sally warns Clyde of Benson's dangerous nature.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Warning in the Office

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Threats and Clyde's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation escalates with direct threats of violence, but Clyde remains resolute in his intention to publish articles exposing Benson, despite Sally's fears.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats

Major_Arcs.title: Public Reaction, Dinner Invitation, and Awkward Dinner
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows the public reaction to Clyde's articles, the decision to invite Chane Benson to dinner as a diplomatic approach, and the resulting awkward and tense dinner encounter.

sub_scenes.title: Public Reaction to Articles and Jeff's Insight
sub_scenes.description: Public reaction to Clyde's articles is shown, with concerns about inciting violence, and Jeff begins to reconsider his view of Chane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight

sub_scenes.title: Considering a Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Mame and Jeff discuss inviting Chane Benson to dinner as a way to understand him and de-escalate the conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Display
sub_scenes.description: The dinner with Chane Benson takes place, marked by Jeff's inappropriate behavior and Mame's discomfort, highlighting Chane's negative influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

Major_Arcs.title: Moonlit Confrontation, Accusations, and Sally's Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc portrays a tense moonlit conversation between Sally and Chane Benson, Sally's direct accusations, and her subsequent confrontation with Jeff, feeling betrayed by his actions.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Conversation and Moonlit Flattery
sub_scenes.description: The dinner continues with Jeff and Mame's brief exchange, followed by Chane Benson flattering Sally in a moonlit setting.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Accusation and Escalating Threat
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Chane, accusing him and questioning Jeff's motives, leading to escalating accusations and veiled threats of violence from Chane.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Confrontation with Jeff
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Jeff, accusing him of betrayal and making a 'deal' with Chane, expressing intense anger and a sense of manipulation.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

Major_Arcs.title: Chane's Dominance, Sally's Realization, and Urgent Action
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Chane Benson asserting his dominance, Sally's emotional reaction and realization of his true nature, and the urgent action needed to save Clyde from imminent danger.

sub_scenes.title: Misunderstanding and Chane's Dominance
sub_scenes.description: Jeff, Sally, and Chane are in a tense standoff, marked by misunderstandings and Chane asserting his dominance and threatening presence.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Reaction and Chane's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Sally reacts emotionally to Chane's dominance and realizes his true nature as he departs, vowing to expose him.

sub_scenes.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Sally realizes Chane has gone after Clyde, prompting urgent action from Jeff to pursue and save Clyde from danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action

sub_scenes.title: Townsmen's Confrontation and Benson's Exit
sub_scenes.description: Townsmen confront Chane Benson, leading to a tense standoff and ultimately Benson being forced to leave town.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen

Major_Arcs.title: Flashback Tension and Resolution of Benson Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc uses flashbacks to build suspense and culminates in the resolution of the conflict with Chane Benson, celebrating courage and decency in journalism.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Confrontation and Flashback Tension
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation with townsmen escalates, intercut with a flashback depicting tense waiting and uncertainty in the Clarion office.

narrative_arcs.title: Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Reflection
sub_scenes.description: The conflict resolves with Benson leaving town, leading to relief and reflection on family, courage, and ethical journalism.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and Ranch Troubles
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Steve Daley to Betsy and establishes the ranch troubles and looming range war, setting up a new conflict and romantic interest.

sub_scenes.title: Physical Confrontation and Introduction of Steve Daley
sub_scenes.description: A brief physical confrontation is followed by Hank Galloway introducing Steve Daley to Betsy, indicating a change in ranch dynamics.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Settling In and Discussion of Steve's Character
sub_scenes.description: Steve settles in, and Betsy and Hank discuss Steve's character and Betsy's reservations about him.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Steve's Character and Past

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Troubles and Betsy's Distrust
sub_scenes.description: Hank explains the ranch's troubles to Betsy, hinting at a range war, and Betsy remains distrustful of Steve despite his offer to help.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts

Major_Arcs.title: Town Confrontation and Steve's Intervention
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a town confrontation between Betsy and Fred Bridges, escalating into physical violence and Steve's intervention to protect Betsy.

sub_scenes.title: Leaving the Store and Sarcastic Remark
sub_scenes.description: Steve and Betsy leave the store, with Betsy making a sarcastic remark, setting a slightly tense tone before the confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Escalating Threat
sub_scenes.description: Betsy is confronted by Fred Bridges, who makes sarcastic remarks and escalating threats, highlighting the ongoing range conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Physical Intervention and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: Steve intervenes physically to protect Betsy, leading to a brawl with Fred Bridges' men and a brief but decisive fight.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Realization, Firing Order, and Romantic Turn
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Betsy realizing Steve is a gunslinger, ordering him fired, reconsidering, and ultimately falling in love with him, leading to a romantic proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Reflection and Firing Order
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on Steve's gunfighting skills and, initially disturbed, orders Hank to fire him.

sub_scenes.title: Reconsideration and Romantic Awakening
sub_scenes.description: Betsy changes her mind, deciding not to fire Steve but to ask him to give up his guns, and realizes she is falling in love with him.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Gunless Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Betsy questions Steve about his profession, leading to a confession of love and Betsy challenging Steve to give up his guns to prove his love, which he accepts, culminating in a kiss.

Major_Arcs.title: Land Dispute, Betrayal Accusations, and Betsy's Resolve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Old Man Bridges confronting Betsy and Hank, Betsy accusing Steve of betrayal, and Betsy resolving to handle the escalating ranch conflict without guns.

sub_scenes.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges confronts Betsy and Hank about ranch troubles, and Hank accuses Bridges of trespassing.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge
sub_scenes.description: Betsy confronts Steve about his past threats, while Steve challenges Hank, escalating the tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Stand Against Guns and Steve's Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Betsy firmly declares she will not use guns, while Steve reflects on past mistakes and a past ambush, showing their differing approaches to conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Resolve, Departure to Devil's Pass, and Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Betsy's decision to take action, her ride to Devil's Pass, and her emotional reunion with Steve after the conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Emotional Resolve and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to use force if necessary and commands her men to ride to Devil's Pass, showing her taking charge.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and her men arrive at Devil's Pass, where she finds Steve and they share an emotional and affectionate reunion.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: New Conflict: Protecting Dave and Range War
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new conflict centered around protecting Dave and a potential range war, shifting focus to Carrie, Dave, and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Argument to Protect Dave
sub_scenes.description: A woman (Carrie) argues with a man (Dave's father) to protect Dave, setting up a personal conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Curley's Arrival and Range Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Curley arrives unexpectedly, and a range conflict with Bar 'C' ranchers is revealed, introducing a broader external conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict

Major_Arcs.title: Fence Dispute and Escalating Tension with Fred Gordon
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the fence dispute with Fred Gordon, escalating tension and leading to a near gunfight, setting the stage for past relationship revelations.

sub_scenes.title: Explaining Fence and Herd Concerns
sub_scenes.description: The rancher explains the importance of the fence for water access and herd management, clarifying the stakes of the range conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns

sub_scenes.title: Fred Gordon's Arrival and Tense Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Fred Gordon arrives with riders, confronting the ranchers about the fence and escalating the tension, leading to a gun draw.

narrative_arcs.title: Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

Major_Arcs.title: Past Apology, Conflicted Feelings, and Present Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc uses flashbacks to reveal past apologies and Carrie's conflicted feelings for Fred, contrasting with the present tense confrontation and evolving romantic tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Flashback Apology and Initial Conflict
sub_scenes.description: A flashback shows Carrie and her group apologizing to Fred Gordon, hinting at a past misunderstanding or conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave discuss Carrie's guilt and her conflicted feelings for both Dave and Fred, revealing a complex emotional triangle.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred

sub_scenes.title: Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie
sub_scenes.description: Returning to the present, Carrie is confronted by Fred Gordon, leading to a tense interaction and setting up further emotional conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie

Major_Arcs.title: Accusations, Romantic Flashback, and Contract Deceit
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc portrays Fred's accusations, Dave's intervention, a flashback to a romantic proposal, and the revelation of Fred's deceitful contract-driven motives.

sub_scenes.title: Accusation and Dave's Intervention
sub_scenes.description: Fred accuses Carrie, and Dave intervenes, leading to escalating emotional tension.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile
sub_scenes.description: Carrie explains her concerns to Dave, while Dave attempts to reconcile and de-escalate the situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

sub_scenes.title: Flashback: Romantic Proposal
sub_scenes.description: A flashback reveals a past romantic proposal from Fred to Carrie, contrasting with the present conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Contract-Driven Proposal and Carrie's Anger
sub_scenes.description: Fred reveals his contract-driven motives for the proposal, leading to Carrie's angry accusation of deceit and manipulation.

sub_scenes.title: Dave's Plea and Carrie's Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Dave pleads with Carrie, but she rejects him in anger, misdirecting her feelings of betrayal.

Major_Arcs.title: Contract Resolution and Romantic Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's assertive confrontation with Mr. Carlton, the resolution of the contract issue in her favor, and her eventual romantic reconciliation with Fred after realizing his true motives.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Resolve and Office Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie resolves to confront Mr. Carlton directly, seeking to rectify Fred's manipulation regarding the contract.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Resolution and Fred's Defeat
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Carlton resolves the contract issue in Carrie's favor, and Carrie sarcastically confronts Fred about his failed plan.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Reassurance and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Carrie finds emotional comfort in her father's arms, and ultimately reconciles romantically with Fred after understanding his true character.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life
Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred
Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation
Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Return, Pursuit, and Wedding Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline with Dirk, his injury, and pursuit by the Marshal, culminating in a wedding disrupted by Dirk's dramatic arrival and a final resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Return and Injury Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Dirk returns injured, and his sister reveals he has been shot, setting up a new crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Dad's Concern and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's father expresses concern and plans to investigate, while Marshal Rance Cready arrives at the ranch looking for Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Discovery and Negotiated Delay
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready finds Dirk injured, asserting his duty to arrest him, but agrees to a negotiated delay for Dirk's recovery.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law

sub_scenes.title: Unexpected Reunion and Ominous Advice
sub_scenes.description: An unexpected reunion occurs, and Chris offers ominous advice to Rance regarding Dirk's escape, hinting at manipulation.

narrative_arcs.title: Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change
Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Confrontation, and Shooting
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris attempt escape, but are pursued by the Marshal, leading to a confrontation and shooting.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Return, and Final Wedding Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris escape, Chris returns to Rance, Dirk is revealed to have escaped to Mexico, and Rance and Chris finally get married.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury
Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
